title: ‘I’m very discouraged’: South Simcoe police’s 2019 Festive RIDE results
text:
South Simcoe Police Service deputy Chief Robin McElary Downer won’t be happy until there are no impaired drivers on the road.

South Simcoe police officers conducted Festive RIDE programs from Nov. 28, 2019 to Jan. 2, 2020. They stopped over 10,000 vehicles and handed out a total of 17 charges related impaired driving, among other charges.

“I’m very discouraged,” McElary Downer said while looking at the numbers. “To me, one is too many."

She’s found herself wondering what it will take for people to get the message not to drive while impaired.
